00141 #define arg_REMOVE4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opremove
00142 #define res_REMOVE4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opremove
00143 
00144 int nfs4_op_remove(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00145                      compound_data_t   * data,
00146                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00147 {
00148   cache_entry_t  * parent_entry = NULL ;
00149   
00150   fsal_attrib_list_t attr_parent;  
00151   fsal_name_t        name ;
00152   
00153   cache_inode_status_t cache_status ;
00154   
00155   char            __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_remove" ;
00156   
00157   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_REMOVE ;
00158   res_REMOVE4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
00159   
00160   
00161   /* If there is no FH */
00162   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00163     {
00164       res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00165       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00166     }
00167   
00168   /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00169   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00170     {
00171       res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00172       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00173     }
00174   
00175   /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00176   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00177     {
00178       res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00179       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00180     }
00181   
00182   /* Pseudo Fs is explictely a Read-Only File system */
00183   if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Pseudo(  &(data->currentFH) ) )
00184     {
00185       res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_ROFS ;
00186       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00187     }
00188   
00189   /* Get the parent entry (aka the current one in the compound data) */
00190   parent_entry = data->current_entry ;
00191   
00192   /* We have to keep track of the 'change' file attribute for reply structure */
00193   memset( &(res_REMOVE4.REMOVE4res_u.resok4.cinfo.before), 0, sizeof( changeid4 ) ) ;
00194   res_REMOVE4.REMOVE4res_u.resok4.cinfo.before = (changeid4)parent_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00195   
00196   /* The operation delete object named arg_REMOVE4.target in directory pointed bt cuurentFH */
00197   /* Make sur the currentFH is pointed a directory */
00198   if( data->current_filetype != DIR_BEGINNING &&  data->current_filetype != DIR_CONTINUE )
00199     {
00200       res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_NOTDIR ;
00201       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00202     }
00203 
00204   /* Check for name length */
00205   if( arg_REMOVE4.target.utf8string_len > FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN )
00206      {
00207        res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_NAMETOOLONG ;
00208        return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00209      }
00210 
00211    /* get the filename from the argument, it should not be empty */
00212    if( arg_REMOVE4.target.utf8string_len == 0 )
00213      {
00214        res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00215        return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00216      }
00217 
00218   
00219   /* NFS4_OP_REMOVE can delete files as well as directory, it replaces NFS3_RMDIR and NFS3_REMOVE
00220    * because of this, we have to know if object is a directory or not */
00221   if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_error_convert(  FSAL_buffdesc2name( (fsal_buffdesc_t *)&arg_REMOVE4.target, 
00222                                                                        &name ) ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00223     {
00224       res_REMOVE4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00225       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00226     }
00227 
00228   /* Test RM7: remiving '.' should return NFS4ERR_BADNAME */ 
00229   if( !FSAL_namecmp( &name, &FSAL_DOT) || !FSAL_namecmp( &name, &FSAL_DOT_DOT ) )
00230     {
00231       res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4ERR_BADNAME ;
00232       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00233     } 
00234   
00235   if( ( cache_status = cache_inode_remove( parent_entry, 
00236                                            &name,
00237                                            &attr_parent, 
00238                                            data->ht, 
00239                                            data->pclient, 
00240                                            data->pcontext,
00241                                            &cache_status ) ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00242     {
00243       res_REMOVE4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00244       return res_REMOVE4.status ;
00245     }
00246   
00247   
00248   /* We have to keep track of the 'change' file attribute for reply structure */
00249   memset( &(res_REMOVE4.REMOVE4res_u.resok4.cinfo.before), 0, sizeof( changeid4 ) ) ;
00250   res_REMOVE4.REMOVE4res_u.resok4.cinfo.after = (changeid4)parent_entry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00251   
00252   /* Operation was not atomic .... */
00253   res_REMOVE4.REMOVE4res_u.resok4.cinfo.atomic = TRUE ;
00254   
00255   /* If you reach this point, everything was ok */
00256   
00257   res_REMOVE4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00258   
00259   return NFS4_OK;
00260 } /* nfs4_op_remove */
00261 
00262     
00273 void nfs4_op_remove_Free( REMOVE4res * resp )
00274 {
00275   /* Nothing to be done */
00276   return ;
00277 } /* nfs4_op_remove_Free */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:44 2009 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.5.7.1
